text: Proteomics analysis is a powerful technology used in a myriad of studies , including those focused on liver diseases ( 3 ) ( 4 ) ( 5 ) ( 6 ) ( 7 ) . Isobaric tags for relative and absolute quantitation ( iTRAQ ) , as a quantitative method , is a common tool in proteomics and has been suggested to be as sensitive as ( or more sensitive than ) the differential in gel electrophoresis ( DIGE ) technique ( 8 ) . Specifically , the iTRAQ method has been used to study a variety of diseases and has been shown to be effective and accurate ( 4 , 5 , 9 ) .
